website_summaries.verdict: An updated classic, with boosted capabilities and functions. A great choice for students and professionals.
pros: Packed with more than 130 built-in functions, this calculator is highly versatile and allows users to customize to their individual needs
Impressive memory retains hundreds of keystrokes
Compact and comes with a padded case
cons: One-line display isn’t as user friendly as some models

customer_reviews.title: A classic that needs no introduction
customer_reviews.text: This is a classic since 1981. The official calculator of the CFA and FRM tests. They used to issue these with ID cards at investment banks. How many electronic devices from the end of the Jimmy Carter era have a life span of 40 year (with internal refreshes of course). 12Cs never seem to break, virtually never run out of batteries, I've bought these over the years not to replace broken units, but because I lose them or pack them away when I change jobs. I currently have 2, somehow I left both in the office when March 2020 lockdown happened, hence this order!
customer_reviews.author: Rei Shinozuka

customer_reviews.title: Not made like they used to
customer_reviews.text: I bought my original HP12C in 2003 and it lasted me 12 years. The rubber pads on the bottom decayed away while the function of the calculator was still good, I regret letting go of it. I replaced it with this version January 2017. Within about a year, I'm already running into problems where I'll hit 7 and 8 and it won't register unless I hit them really hard. Really disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby-B-Bot

customer_reviews.title: Garbage.  I went to buy a used one made in the USA elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty pathetic that one of the best products ever made by HP is now made in China and is so crappy that the industrial strength buttons don't even work. It's the sad state of affairs of life today. Warning: if you buy this it might last a few months, but it will probably have the keys sticking soon. It's a shame, too, because the old ones lasted forever. I had my first one for 15 years.
customer_reviews.author: Paige Turner

customer_reviews.title: Dissappointed
customer_reviews.text: The Original 12C was gold in color. This is Silver. That's okay except that the wording above the keys are in red and very very difficult to read! Feels more plastic than my original. Screen is cheaper and if finger pressure is applied it distorts a bit. Also the case is really too tight to be useful. Calculator does work, has click keys and performs. But due to cheaper feel and difficulty in reading the the wording above the keys I wouldn't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Buy This Financial Calculator!
customer_reviews.text: This is a state of the art financial calculator! There are many functions that an accountant could only dream of a few years ago. It is hard to learn just by looking at it, but a manual and DVD with instructions is included. There are ample opportunities online to learn as well. The keys are clean and easy to press. It is a good size to put in your pocket and even comes with a protective case.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Miller

customer_reviews.title: This is my Go To Calculator
customer_reviews.text: This is my second HP12C. The first was purchased over 35 years ago and only died after a soda spilled unnoticed into the carrying case. There are so many calculations that can be made using the HP12C . One thing to note is that this is a reverse logic type calculator. In simple english if you are used to using a desktop type adding machine it may take some getting used to pressing the add/subtract button after the entered number. I say this because I was fortunate enough to learn on the HP12C and it took some brain power to untrain myself when a job required the use of a desktop adding machine.
customer_reviews.author: mltadvantage

customer_reviews.title: Not Reliable!
customer_reviews.text: After a few weeks the keys started repeating - For example if you hit 5 you may get 55 or 555, or hit 75 and just get 7. Unnerving when you are working fast to not be confident in your calculator! I've had 3 or 4 12Cs over 35+ years, this is the first time I ever had issues, but I read where many others have similar problems in other reviews. Sad because I have been these calculators every day for so long.
customer_reviews.author: D. DERANGO

customer_reviews.title: Nice calculator for professionals, not ideal for students
customer_reviews.text: I'm a finance undergraduate student currently and bought this calculator for taking exams where programmable calculators are not allowed. It does most of its job well, except for solving for the number of periods. It rounds to the nearest integer which is frustrating when professors are looking for exact decimal answers. If you are buying a financial calculator for college buy the TI BA II+
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Goodman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Financial Calculator
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement calculator for me. I have used an HP 12c for 20 years. The keys on my old one finally gave out. Thank goodness I could find a replacement and even upgrade to the Platinum. I rated easy to learn as only 3 stars since learning to use RPN instead of algebraic can take some time. Same on easy to read just because you need a fair amount of finance knowledge to really understand the formulas and thence the keys. But by far, I believe this financial calculator is the best for power, size, and durability. The ordering and delivery were all perfect, just like you expect from Amazon and vendors that utilize Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Spur

customer_reviews.title: How about an Instruction Manual in English?!?!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this calculator for a real estate class I'm taking. It arrived on time. The only problem is the packaging and instruction manual are not in English!!!!! So now I also have to learn another language to read the manual to learn how to use the calculator on top of learning these real estate formulas? Not going to happen. For that, 1 star. If I receive a manual in English without my being inconvenienced, I will up my rating.
customer_reviews.author: Codered1293

customer_reviews.title: Product has a multitude of features and processor is very fast.
customer_reviews.text: Only gave this calculator 4 stars in each category as it is a complicated product and there is a learning curve to using it. However, the calculations are for the most part, clearly defined on the keys once you familiarize yourself with it. I gave it only 3 stars overall as the first one I ordered malfunctioned just after the return window expired. Tried replacing the batteries hoping that would be the fix, but not so. Needed to use it immediately so sending back to the manufacturer was not an option. Second purchase seems to be holding up fine.
customer_reviews.author: Diane from Phoenix MD

customer_reviews.title: HP 12CP Financial Calculator -- You can't beat it. Quit dithering and buy one already.
customer_reviews.text: I got through business school in the early 80s using an HP 12c. Somehow it got away from me last year. I tried getting by with a cheapo, but gave it up as a bad deal and bought this. Maybe it's just what I'm used to, but I really like it. One thing especially, the display is really easy to read. Makes a big difference if you're trying to work quickly. Finally, in 1983 I paid $150 1983 dollars for a 12c. Now this one is 1/3 of that.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Stuart

customer_reviews.title: How do you rate perfection?
customer_reviews.text: The H-P 12C is one of those rare products that is so close to being perfect that experienced users can't recommend ANY improvement. I have used them for decades and they are still the gold standard for hand-held financial calculations. A commercial banker without a 12C is like a racecar driver on foot. This one was priced competitively and delivered ahead of schedule.
customer_reviews.author: Richard C. Insley

customer_reviews.title: Financial registers occupies XYZ stack?
customer_reviews.text: I was following a complex financial calculation from a 1987 printed hp 12c course. It tells to add the previous PMT value calculated to the PMT just calculated (in the X stack). I can't do it with the existing stack because YZ and T are all overwritten by the current financial registers. This is wrong. Financial registers should be where they are (i, n, PMT, PV, FV) and not push the stack up. Is there a setting somewhere I miss?
customer_reviews.author: Bud

customer_reviews.title: Dad used to work for HP
customer_reviews.text: A long time ago my dad used to work for HP and always brought home calculators for me. A couple of years ago someone absconded by 20 year old 12C and I've been missing it ever since. This one isn't bad, but the keys lack the tactile feel of my original. I don't know, maybe the old one was wore out but this one just isn't the same. That said, so far so good, I've had no problems with it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad they still make and sell this classic!
customer_reviews.text: I have to say, the price was good, the product works great - and it is much faster than my old dear 12C (I've owned a 12C since 1986). I do wish the keys would have the old units softer feel - the new one is more "clicky" - not a big deal... Also, while the case is nice, I actually like the old vinyl one from my old 12C better... The new one is very stiff, and hard to get the calc. in and out... BTW - if you have an iphone, there is a 12c app that works for you when out and about...
customer_reviews.author: Harry Lisle

customer_reviews.title: I bought this calculator, first HP calculator, specifically ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this calculator, first HP calculator, specifically for the financial feature. Whenever numeric keys are depressed, intermittently the depressed number appears twice causing an erroneous result. It's a laborious task when every step of a several step operation is having to be rechecked to ensure no duplication.
customer_reviews.author: shirley johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great Financial Calculator!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first financial calculator so when it comes down to comparing the HP-12CP to other calculators I am not too knowledgeable but what i can say is that this calculator works like a charm. The calculator was brand new when i got it. I was able to use the calculator for my managerial accounting class which was very necessary when computing things relating to the Time Value of Money. When it comes down to the functions i had to look it up on youtube so if you have never had a financial calculator before i suggest you go to youtube for a little guidance. Overall, I truly love this calculator.
customer_reviews.author: OC

customer_reviews.title: Calculator was defective
customer_reviews.text: I bought this calculator for the CFP test, but when I tried to use it for the first time none of the keys even worked. I bought new batteries thinking that maybe they had just run out, but it still didn't work. I am extremely disappointed in Open Group Market for selling me a defective calculator, especially because these are pricey. Hopefully they will give me a refund to make up for reselling defective products.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unusual system to learn
customer_reviews.text: Tbh, this calculator is not for everyone. Reverse Polish Notation is pretty unusual. After using it for a while and getting the hang of it. I can say it is my go to calculator for my Accounting and Finance courses. It seems to work pretty well. I would watch some videos on how to get started. I can see it being hard for someone who isn't really familiar with it. I would recommend you should use it whenever you have an opportunity. It will help cement the unconventional notation.
customer_reviews.author: Tavish Phommavongsay

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY IF YOU APPRECIATE QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT the quality of yesteryear. This is made in China and you can tell. The buttons are silk screened, unlike in the past when the numbers were part of the injection. These numbers WILL wear off. The color of the "gold/orange" button is not correct. The buttons are cheap plastic and do NOT have the correct tactile feel. This is an extreme embarrassment for HP quality. I can't express how disappointing it is. I would return it if I could but the packaging is such that you must destroy it to open it.
customer_reviews.author: Domenic

customer_reviews.title: My assistant
customer_reviews.text: If you are working in the mortgage line of work, this is an excellent little helper. I really use it for calculating mortgage payments. For just this little feature, it is so worth paying the $50. Plus it speeds up the manual calculations.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A step below the original HP
customer_reviews.text: I like the new speedy processor but really miss the display blink after each operation. That visual feedback was a useful feature. It's inexplicable why they would remove such a helpful attribute. It would seem it was re-designed by someone who never used one. I have had no trouble with the keys as reported by some. Revised: May 2016. The calculator has failed. It acts like weak batteries but new batteries don't fix it. Too late to send it back for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Craig

customer_reviews.title: What happened to the "better buttons"?
customer_reviews.text: As a long time HP 12 and 17 user, I am accustomed to the high quality, solid click of the original keys. This edition feels considerably cheaper in quality of construction. Functionality seems to be the same but I want my firm, solid feeling keys back!
customer_reviews.author: Kent A. Kramer

customer_reviews.title: it's the only calculator for me!
customer_reviews.text: I grew up with the HP 12C . .. or at least that was the gold standard when I was going to college eons ago? I spazzed when my college HP 12C gave up the ghost after over 20 years, and was so happy to find that it's still available. YAYS!!! Reverse Polish Notation is the way my mind thinks, so thank goodness this old workhorse is still around.
customer_reviews.author: L. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Missing User Guide
customer_reviews.text: This didn’t include the Users Guide only the Start Up Guide. The start up guide specifically refers to “pages” in the users guide to learn the difference function. If cd is supposed to be equivalent to the user guide - that’s not gonna fit it.
customer_reviews.author: DMMO

customer_reviews.title: Replace HP12C
customer_reviews.text: I use the HP12C for financial calculations in Real Estate. The HP12C I have now the keys would stick and sometimes they wouldn't work, this is a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Sunset

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I Needed
customer_reviews.text: I needed this calculator to be compliant with testing regulations for some real estate courses. While the RPN takes a bit of time to learn, you get used to it quickly with even the smallest bit of daily practice. I almost can't use a regular calculator now. I also really appreciate the storage and recall capabilities on this calculator; it makes multi-faceted problems a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: EG

customer_reviews.title: Documentation, guides and packaging are not in English
customer_reviews.text: Just received the calculator today. This review is regarding the fact that Amazon sent me full packaging, reference manual, etc. in Spanish, not English, so is useless to me. If everything on the calculator works OK and like my old one, I'll update the review. But I am not a happy camper that the Quick Guide is useless and that it wasn't disclosed that I was buying a Spanish language version. (The enclosed CD did include a full manual in English, but have to use an electronic device to use it.)
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Calculator keys stopped working this morning after one month of use!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this calculator for about a month and it is not functioning correctly as of today. The 0, 1, 4, 7 and other important function keys (including the clear button) are not working. Obviously, this means the calculator is useless. I paid $51.00 and expect a product that works for this amount!
customer_reviews.author: megmyday

customer_reviews.title: Great price for this model calculator
customer_reviews.text: I have used the HP12C for years. I recently needed to get my third one. This was the best price out there. The calculator even came with a very nice case. I'm thinking of picking up another one for a gift for a friend
customer_reviews.author: Pastcha

customer_reviews.title: A classic calculator that's even more powerful
customer_reviews.text: My HP-12C Platinum calculator is just what I expected. I used a hand-me-down original 12C in business school. The 12CP is more responsive, and has a few modern calculator features (such as the ability to delete an erroneous value) that make it the equal of rivals from TI. Plus, I like the form factor; there's something to be said for a calculator you can easily hold in two hands and control intuitively that way, with a little practice.
customer_reviews.author: H. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: FRAGILE - Handle with care
customer_reviews.text: Very good calculator, but breaks extremely easily. I feel like these calculators are made out of very delicate glass, any bump and your keys or LCD will not work. I understand a desk calculator isn't designed to be a rugged device, but I've babied this unit and it didn't last very long. I have a feeling HP Quality isn't what it used to be 10 or 20 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Ron G

customer_reviews.title: a poor replacement for the hp 12c
customer_reviews.text: I had no idea that adding the word "platinum" was a warning signal that this is a poor imitation of the original product. It is made in the Phillippines and has a pretend leather hard-as-a-rock case. The calculator itself is just lighter and flimsier in every way. It doesn't feel right.
customer_reviews.author: HappyIntheKitchen

customer_reviews.title: Looks and feels good
customer_reviews.text: I haven't really begun to use this but initial quality seems good. The batteries come pre-installed. The buttons are nice and tight and responsive too. My only complaint is that that they sent the it in Spanish packaging along with 2 instructions manuals that were both in Spanish, no bueno. Fortunately there was also a CD which has the English instruction manual and other resources.
customer_reviews.author: Jerome

customer_reviews.title: Improved Performance on a Great Device
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife as she lives on this calculator for her work. She's been using one she's had for I want to say almost 20 years. My wife said this one is much faster than her older one.
customer_reviews.author: ScottD91

customer_reviews.title: For the CFP, CLU, ChFC, CASL, CLTC, AEP, and other designations this is one of two calculators that can be used.
customer_reviews.text: This product is great in the sense that it is accepted by the CFP board and American College. However the 12C is nowhere near as good as my HP 50G. My 50G is more accurate, doesn't round "N" in TVM calculations, etc. So if you don't have to have this calculator due to regulations, buy the HP50G for $15 more. This calculator has a long battery life and comes in a nice leather case with a spot for a business card. It does have equations printed on the back that have to be "covered up" for the designation tests above. I wish they wouldn't print them on the back. It's annoying to have to tape the back and looks ghetto.
customer_reviews.author: Adam L. Way

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for the HP-15C
customer_reviews.text: I wanted and HP 15-C , but bought the 12-C that looks and feel like a HP 15-C . the swiss micros clone hp 15c is over $100 with shipping added. I may buy the swiss micros since I used the HP 15-C in college, nostalgia you can say. HP bring back the HP-15C.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Time-Proven Quality
customer_reviews.text: Great Reverse Polish keyboard, important functions, compact size, proven HP quality, adequate math functions to serve also as a scientific calculator replacement for the old 13C instrument, also from HP. Good enough instructions for learning new uses
customer_reviews.author: CEK

customer_reviews.title: as expected
customer_reviews.text: I got this for a class. It has proven to be what it was expected to be. Once I get more comfortable with the process/steps for figuring out mortgages, loans, amortization, int vs prin, etc, I plan on using it to confuse some car salespeople.
customer_reviews.author: rhunter

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I still love the 12c but unfortunately quality is so poor compared to my original that finally died. This is now my second and each has had small problems. A slight warp that makes it wobble on the desk. Keys that require just a little extra effort. I would pay more for better. Sad.
customer_reviews.author: Richard W

customer_reviews.title: Last of the real America
customer_reviews.text: This show us the down hill America, I used this on my MBA. Yey at 56 received another Masters - must keep learning and needed this calculator like my Scientific I use on the design of new rockets. This is finance - Buy today before you can not find one
customer_reviews.author: Thomas F. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: SHAME ON HP
customer_reviews.text: Instructions and CD User manual are a waste of time unless already familiar with this type of calculator. Wish I still had my old TI finance calculator.
customer_reviews.author: bighoov

customer_reviews.title: Best Financial Calculator for Beginners
customer_reviews.text: Great financial calculator for beginners. You definitely need to read the directions or take a class with some instruction, because this does not function like a normal calculator, but once you learn, it is amazing what it can do.
customer_reviews.author: Royer

customer_reviews.title: Probably my seventh 12-C since the early 80s. I ...
customer_reviews.text: Probably my seventh 12-C since the early 80s. I have been a financial professional since 1974 and this is the de facto standard. The keys wear out more quickly ever since they stopped making it in the US
customer_reviews.author: D. Cutter

customer_reviews.title: Still a star performer!
customer_reviews.text: Technically a 5 star, but HP isn't producing similar great calculators any longer; ie HP15, etc. For everyday stuff and financial this calculator is the standard - Buttons have a great feel - all have the same responsiveness/feel. Most importantly it uses RPN. Once you've learned RPN it is really frustrating to go back to ALG.
customer_reviews.author: Gene Yus

customer_reviews.title: Great calculator
customer_reviews.text: I love RPN calculators. This is one of the most useful day to day. It's easy to find rates of return, payments and such as well as just regular old math stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Lockhart

customer_reviews.title: Realtor husband loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Husband had used one for years with his real estate. His very old one died and he couldn't wait to get the replacement. It is complicated, but he understands it and is lost without it.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Jo

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my son whose currently taking courses to get his Real Estate Appraisal license. He used it for his first exam & said it worked splendidly. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: LDSDME1

customer_reviews.title: I still hate the RPN and way of entering data
customer_reviews.text: While these are very practical calculators, especially for anyone in finance, real estate and similar fields. I still hate the RPN and way of entering data. I just wish they still made the 19bs
customer_reviews.author: FinnDave

customer_reviews.title: As good as your old one you don't want to replace
customer_reviews.text: I really beat my 12c up over a nine-year period, and it just wasn't having it. So, I replaced it and voila, it's just as good (if not better) than the original.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Dembowitz

customer_reviews.title: Inferior to Texas Instruments Version
customer_reviews.text: Business student here, going into bond trading next year. I have tried both this and the Texas Instruments version (both allowed on the CFA btw), and while this one 'embodies' Wall Street more (i.e. more iconic), it is less effective and more cumbersome in terms of utility. You have to learn a new way of inputting values, there are fewer functions, and it is less ergonomic in the hand. Save some money on a better calculator.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: The Gold Standard of Calculators.
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? Even with all of the calculators on computers and phones today, sometimes I really want a regular, gold-standard calculator. HP has many choices and I've been using RPN [Reverse Polish Notation] since undergrad engineering school, so I'm grateful these are still around. I should mention that while there are many functions available on this machine, I rely on Microsoft Excel for most of those. Maybe I'm a throwback, but when I lost my HP17C [I have no idea how], this replaced it admirably. I didn't really explore other brands. It's probably a combination of RPN and the buttons, which are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan O'Connor

customer_reviews.title: Calculator was received as promised.
customer_reviews.text: The calculator was received as promised, it was as advertised, am very please with the unit as well as service.
customer_reviews.author: Charles R. McCook

customer_reviews.title: Good old things
customer_reviews.text: The elderly HP-12 is still "the king of the road", at least for HP fans. Easy to use, small enough to get into a shirt pocket so you can take it everywhere, does the work one needs. No graphs indeed, no bells and whistles, but no any disappointments either. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: YuvalMW

customer_reviews.title: One of the best I've ever owned!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, the best financial calculator out today. I own 12c (which for its age is a great calculator). But 12c platinum is so much faster, with more features and longer battery life. I am an MBA student and this is by far the best calculator for school and work. If you are looking for a financial calculator, do not waste your money on other brands and models (especially HP 20b),spend a little more money and get the calculator that will last a lifetime. I think HP should stop making computers and concentrate on making great financial products.
customer_reviews.author: V. Orlov

customer_reviews.title: It’s versatile.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned 12Cs for thirty years. I especially like the reverse Polish notation. This calculator goes a step further by allowing algebraic options. This calculator does it all.
customer_reviews.author: G. M. Callahan

customer_reviews.title: a classic
customer_reviews.text: my first HP 12 c was back in 1977.. since then I have had several .. this latest model is the best model I have had.. manufactured in the philippines and quality is tops..
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: For my son’s Managerial Accounting class
customer_reviews.text: My son needed this calculator for his college Managerial Accounting class. He says it has all of the functions he needs for the class.
customer_reviews.author: dl design

customer_reviews.title: Packaging and all user manuals are only in Spanish.
customer_reviews.text: Not in English. The two user manuals are only in Spanish. Amazon neglected to disclose that fact in its product listing. Really pretty dumb. I’ve used HP12 for decades, but this is my first HP12C Platinum. It would have been nice to be able to read any of the materials.
customer_reviews.author: LouisR

customer_reviews.title: HP12CP is an excellent financial calculator - highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: This is a great and high quality calculator. It is well worth your effort to learn RPN in order to gain the maximum use of it. I purchased it for use in MBA program courses and much prefer it to the TI BA II+. it does have one short coming and that is that during TVM calcs it can only display whole years (periods) and not partial. I also like the horizontal format better than the vertical format and find it more ergonomic.
customer_reviews.author: Ron R.

customer_reviews.title: Love this calculator
customer_reviews.text: This is not a calculator for everyone, but an awesome product for those that know how to use it. Have been using it since the early 2000’s and love all that it does for my insurance and real estate businesses.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cutting edge / great performer
customer_reviews.text: I really like my new HP 12C Platinum calculator! I have used an HP 12C for many years, but decided to take the step of an upgrade to Platinum and I am very happy with its performance. The provider of this product delivered it very quickly right to my door! Thanks again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: An improved classic
customer_reviews.text: I had an older 10-B that used an Algebraic input method, after spilling coffee on it, it died (lasted 12 years). This machine has the ability to toggle between Reverse Polish Notation (RPN) and Algebraic, very nice since I am still getting use to the RPN. This made buying the machine very easy since all the formulas I used on the 10-B I could use on the 12C Platinum. So to sum up, when I get frustrated with RPN I just switch over and everything works fine. These are high quality machines that should last for decades so well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: M. Waits

customer_reviews.title: Not what it used to be
customer_reviews.text: I owned my first HP 12C for at least 15 years. This new Chinese-made version lasted less than one year. The enter key no longer works making the calculator worthless. This calculator is very expensive if it becomes worthless in less than one year. I will have to buy another one because I love to use this calculator and find it difficult to use any other. Hopefully the shoddy construction is just a fluke.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Great Calculator!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the hp12C for 40 years, and this is my 4th one, The HP 12C Platinum is the best one yet mainly because it has two batteries instead of one, which extends the operating life. Also the keys seem much more responsive that the perilous ones I have owned.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph White

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: The classic calculator. This one has a few more bells and whistles than the first one I bought entering the financial planning profession some 35 years ago!
customer_reviews.author: Walter Dobrowolski

customer_reviews.title: ¿Por qué están las instrucciones en español?
customer_reviews.text: The calculator is as expected, and it's great, but all the packaging and instructions are in Spanish.
customer_reviews.author: MO_Sports

customer_reviews.title: GRRRRRREAT Calculatior
customer_reviews.text: I just recently purchased my 2nd HP12C.....My first HP12C is still working just fine after 20+ years of using everyday but I wanted another one to have in the car on those days I forget to put it in my briefcase when rushing out of the office. If you are in need of a financial Calculator this is the one for you. ...10 STARS form me HP
customer_reviews.author: Mike L

customer_reviews.title: Great Calculator
customer_reviews.text: It takes a bit to sort out how to use this calculator, but once you do you find it indispensible.
customer_reviews.author: CJS

customer_reviews.title: "Texas BAII Plus" had better screen and is more simple and intuitive to use

product_meta.title: HP 12CP Financial Calculator
product_meta.description:
HP 12c Platinum is a faster, enhanced version of the industry-leading 12c calculator designed for the financial professional who demands more. Enjoy both RPN and Algebraic modes of entry, keystroke programming with four times more memory for up to 400 steps and more-than 130 built-in functions. There are now advanced editing features like the new "Undo" and "Backspace" buttons. Plus six times faster speeds for calculating TVM, loan payments, interest rates, standard deviation and more. Work more efficiently with memory for up to 80 cash flows. Ideal for real estate, finance, accounting, economics and business work. The easy-to-use layout and stylish look with metal back plate suitable for engraving make it a welcome addition to any desktop or a great gift idea. Permitted for use on the CFP and CFA Certification Exams, and GARP FRM Exam. You also get the reassurance of award-winning HP support available to you 24-hours a day, as well as an enhanced website with tutorials, educational resources and downloads.

AMAZON.COM
The HP 12C Platinum Edition is a fast and powerful calculator designed for educators, businessmen, or anyone who needs a reliable tool to handle mathematical and/or financial calculations. With a 400 step memory capacity, the 12C can handle even the most complex computations. For 25 years, the 12C has proven its reputation as the ultimate pocket-size calculator for financial use. The HP 12C Platinum is a faster, enhanced version of the industry-leading 12C, and is designed for the financial professional who demands more options. Its long battery life and small size make it easy to take with you anywhere, and its elegant black and silver design, and engravable metal plate on the back give it a modern, stylish appearance. The 12C Platinum is a powerful tool capable of handling the most complex and detailed analysis and problem solving. With over 130 built-in functions for business, finance, mathematics and statistics including date calculations, this calculator offers fast and reliable programming, finance, and statistical analysis options. With the 12C, you'll enjoy the flexibility of both RPN (Reverse Polish Notation) and algebraic modes of entry, the speed of its processor, and the increased memory capacity.

 Precision Business and Finance Features
Ideal for real estate, finance, accounting, economics and business work, this calculator also helps you perform several key functions that allow you to make financial predictions, balance your budget, or calculate percentages of appreciation or depreciation for mortgages, loans, and savings accounts. Advanced editing features like the new "Undo" and "Backspace" buttons ensure precise calculations, while six times faster speeds for calculating TVM, loan payments, and interest rates help you gather and analyze important data in minutes. You can also pinpoint trends by performing cumulative statistical analysis, standard deviation, mean, weighted mean, and linear regression.

 Memory For Up to 30 Cash Flows
The 12C offers several modes and an easy-to-use layout for a wide range of practical applications. For example, perform TVM (Time Value of Money) functions like calculating mortgage/loan payments. Or perform NPV (Net Present Value) and IRR (Internal Rate of Return) computations to help determine whether or not to undertake a particular investment project. With memory for up to 30 cash flows, it's a snap to manage a series of complex projects. For additional convenience, the 12C is also permitted for use on the CFP and CFA Certification Exams, and the GARP FRM Exam.

 What's in the Box
12C financial calculator, battery, and user's manual.
